com.psddev.dari.util

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.psddev.dari.util.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Task>, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncConsumer, AsyncProducer

    public abstract class Task
extends Object
implements Comparable<Task>, Runnable
    Skeletal runnable implementation that contains basic execution control and status methods. Subclasses must implement:
    • doTask()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Task()
      Creates an instance that will run in the default executor anonymously.
      protected Task(String name)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Task(String, String) instead.
      protected Task(String initialExecutor, String initialName)
      Creates an instance that will run in the given initialExecutor with the given initialName.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        protected Task(String initialExecutor,
    String initialName)
        Creates an instance that will run in the given initialExecutor with the given initialName.
        Parameters:
        initialExecutor - If null, this task will run in the default executor.
        initialName - If blank, this task will be named based on its class name and the count of all instances created so far.

      • Task

        protected Task()
        Creates an instance that will run in the default executor anonymously.

      • Task

        @Deprecated
protected Task(String name)
        Deprecated. Use Task(String, String) instead.
        Creates an instance that will run in the default executor with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - If blank, this task will be named based on its class name and the count of all instances created so far.

    • Method Detail

      • getExecutor

        public TaskExecutor getExecutor()
        Returns the executor that will run this task.
        Returns:
        Never null.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the name.
        Returns:
        Never blank.

      • getFuture

        public Future<?> getFuture()
        Returns the future.
        Returns:
        null if this task hasn't been started or scheduled.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts running this task. Does nothing if this task has already been started but hasn't begun running yet.

      • scheduleOnce

        public void scheduleOnce(double initialDelay)
        Schedule this task to run after the given initialDelay. Does nothing if this task has already been scheduled but hasn't begun running yet.

      • schedule

        public void schedule(double initialDelay,
            double periodicDelay)
        Schedule this task to run after the given initialDelay and forever after every periodicDelay. Does nothing if this task has already been scheduled.

      • getThread

        public Thread getThread()
        Returns the thread where this task is running.
        Returns:
        null if this task isn't running.

      • isInterrupted

        public boolean isInterrupted()
        Returns true if the thread running this task has been interrupted.
        Returns:
        Always false if this task isn't running.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if this task is currently running.

      • isPauseRequested

        public boolean isPauseRequested()
        Returns true if pause() has been called on this task.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Tries to pause this task.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes this task if it's paused.

      • isStopRequested

        public boolean isStopRequested()
        Returns true if stop() has been called on this task.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Tries to stop this task.

      • getLastRunBegin

        public long getLastRunBegin()
        Returns the time when the last run of this task began.
        Returns:
        Milliseconds since the epoch. -1 if this task never ran.

      • getLastRunEnd

        public long getLastRunEnd()
        Returns the time when the last run of this task ended.
        Returns:
        Milliseconds since the epoch. -1 if this task is currenting running.

      • getRunDuration

        public long getRunDuration()
        Returns the run duration for this task. If it's not currently running, this method returns the measurement from the last run.
        Returns:
        In milliseconds. -1 if this task never ran.

      • getProgress

        public String getProgress()
        Returns the progress.
        Returns:
        null if the progress isn't available.

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(String newProgress)
        Sets the progress. For numeric progress, consider using setProgressIndex(long) and setProgressTotal(long) instead.

      • getProgressIndex

        public long getProgressIndex()
        Returns the progress index.
        Returns:
        -1 if the progress index isn't available.

      • setProgressIndex

        public void setProgressIndex(long newProgressIndex)
        Sets the progress index. Also updates the progress string.

      • addProgressIndex

        public void addProgressIndex(long amount)
        Adds the given amount to the progress index. Also updates the progress string.

      • getProgressTotal

        public long getProgressTotal()
        Returns the progress total.
        Returns:
        -1 if the progress total isn't available.

      • setProgressTotal

        public void setProgressTotal(long newProgressTotal)
        Sets the progress total. Also updates the progress string.

      • getLastException

        public Throwable getLastException()
        Returns the exception thrown from the last run of this task.
        Returns:
        null if there wasn't an error.

      • getRunCount

        public long getRunCount()
        Returns the number of times that this task ran.
